resources.string: Floating Windows extension for rooted Desktop Mode users

This extension modifies the system. Therefore, bad things can happen, including (but not limited to): crashes, bootloops, bricked devices, cosmic explosions, system instability, alien invasions, etc.

Jokes aside, we claim no responsibility for any damage caused by this extension, and by accepting this disclaimer, hold the sole responsibility of any damages done.

If this scared you, you can calm down a bit. This has been tested on numerous devices without problem. And in effect, nothing SHOULD go wrong. But your device might be different, and it has a small possibility of something backfiring. Hence the disclaimer ;)

Now we can proceed activating the extension!

Actually, this is an Xposed module (https://jonathan-apps.com/help/faq/what-is-xposed/), which requires the Xposed Framework. If you already have Xposed, tap on "ENABLE".

Otherwise, tap on "DOWNLOAD".
This floating app has been minimized
Do not pause the below app when a Floating window is above. (Toggling may cause bugs)
Pause the below app when a Floating window is above. (May cause bugs)
The action the popup will do when a keyboard opens. (Changing this may cause bugs)
Disable closing the app window when screen turns off or home is pressed. (Changing this may cause bugs)
Allows the app to be shown in the recents screen. (Not recommended)
Force the app to be shown in recents screen, regardless of the app\'s configuration. (Not recommended)
Force New Windows to open in floating mode
If an app is currently open in floating mode, new apps that open above it are forced to open in floating mode. (Recommended)
Force new windows snap side by side
No floating apps on start, just AeroSnaps
Choose a list of apps to never open in floating mode. (Use in case the app doesn\'t work in floating mode)
Newly ignored apps needs to be force-closed for changes to take effect.\n\nYou may single press on the app icon for the app info to open. After which, you may select Force Stop.

There was an error opening the App Info.
This is the error.
Choose a list of apps to always open in floating mode

Newly added apps needs to be force-closed for changes to take effect.

You may single press on the app icon for the app info to open. After which, you may select Force Stop.

Note that ignoring has a higher priority over forcing if you were to select the same app in both lists.
Choose a list of apps to always open maximized
Newly auto maximized apps need to be force-closed for changes to take effect.\n\nYou may single press on the app icon for the app info to open. After which, you may select Force Stop.
Choose a list of apps to show in launcher menu. (DEPRECATED: FloatDot Launcher is not relevant to Desktop Mode)
To reopen apps as movable you might need to force-close them for changes to take effect.\n\nYou may single press on the app icon for the app info to open. After which, you may select Force Stop.
Choose a different behavior to use the black and whitelist. (DEPRECATED: Always allow all apps, except those ignored)
If new windows should automaticaly snap side by side. (Not recommended, may have bugs)
Set less to unsnap easier, more to avoid unwanted unsnaps

This flag is attached to windows so the systems knows their status.
Choose the Old style to have old launchers working, but you will have infamous Chrome bug.
NB: To use new flag your launcher must pass it instead of/with the old one.
(DEPRECATED: DesktopMode always uses new id)
A feature similar to multi-window for true multi-tasking.
Show a titlebar at the top of the window for dragging
Show a separator line below the titlebar (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Separator Line Size (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Height of the separator line below the titlebar (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Separator Line Color (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
The color of the separator line below the titlebar (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Changes the titlebar icons to the older version (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
When enabled, the close button will close the entire app instead of that individual window.\n(Requires Android 4.1 and above)
Hides the titlebar when maximized and show it again when resizing. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
When opening a new window of the same app, place them in the same position and size of the original.
When resizing or moving a window, windows of the same app behind it will also be updated.
When resizing windows, contents will refresh immediately instead of showing an outline.\n(Unstable, may reduce performance)
Drag a window to the any 4 edges of the screen to resize it to the respective half of the screen, similar to Aero Snap in Windows OS.
Delay in milliseconds before snap-in outline is shown.
Draw a focus frame on active snapped window.
Set Color for focused window frame and resizing overlay.
When 2 or more windows are snapped to the same side of the screen, use 2 fingers to swipe left or right to switch between them.
Hides the titlebar when snapping and show it again when unsnapping or resizing.\n(Requires Snap-in Windows to be enabled)\n (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Use the ActionBar (or the top area for apps with no ActionBar) to move windows.
Show a triangle on the bottom left of the window for additional actions. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Color of the corner triangle. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Transparency of the corner triangle. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Size of the corner triangle. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
The action that will occur when clicking the corner triangle. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
The action that will occur when long pressing the corner triangle. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Show a quadrant on the bottom right of the window for additional actions. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Color of the corner quadrant. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Transparency of the corner quadrant. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Size of the corner quadrant. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
The action that will occur when clicking the corner quadrant. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
The action that will occur when long pressing the corner quadrant. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Use to resize window when dragged. (Changing this may cause bugs)
Use to move window when dragged. (Changing this may cause bugs)
Show a border around the edge of the window.
Color of the border. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Thickness of the border in pixels.
Show applications in statusbar when minimized. (DEPRECATED: Taskbar already provides this functionality)
Use the app\'s Primary Dark color for the titlebar.
Maximum HS[V] before auto-switching to black icons.\n(Ignored when action bar has a custom text color)\n(Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Change the window border (if enabled) to the titlebar color. (Will be permanently enabled soon)
Change the triangle and quadrant (if enabled) to the titlebar color. (Beware, will be deprecated soon)
Show Drag To Move Bar (Hide Corners)
Show Drag To Move Bar (Don\'t Hide Corners)

Collection of SystemUI modifications. (DEPRECATED: MAY BREAK THE SYSTEM, CAUSE INSTABILITY, BOOTLOOPS, OVERHEATING (POTENTIALLY LEADING TO FIRE), AND EVEN BE HAZARDOUS. SERIOUSLY, WE ARE NOT KIDDING. PROCEED AT YOUR OWN RISK.)

MAY BREAK THE SYSTEM, CAUSE INSTABILITY, BOOTLOOPS, OVERHEATING (POTENTIALLY LEADING TO FIRE), AND EVEN BE HAZARDOUS. SERIOUSLY, WE ARE NOT KIDDING. THE RISK INCREASES IF YOU RUN LOLLIPOP OR HIGHER. PROCEED AT YOUR OWN RISK.
These mods are for AOSP-based ROMs and, thus, untested with other ROMs. If you experience continuous SystemUI force closes, IMMEDIATELY disable these mods. It\'s for your own good.
Adds \"Open in Halo\" option when long-pressing notifications.
Use together with \"Long Press Notification Option\". Unlike the above, it adds \"Open Normally\" when long-pressing & allows single-clicking notification to open in halo.
Open Quick Settings tiles in floating window
Prevent Moving Home to the front
Prevent the homescreen from being brought front when using the recent apps screen.
Long Press Recent Apps Item Option
Adds \"Open in Halo\" option when long-pressing an item in the recent apps.
Restart for changes to take effect.\n(Requires SU Permission)
Test the opening of floating windows
You should be able to launch standard apps in floating mode.

You will not be able to launch standard apps in floating mode.

Please try disabling and enabling this module in the Xposed Framework, and reboot.

 If that did not solve your issue, please report a bug below.
ERROR: Unable to determine if module is active. Please report the bug below.
Launch Settings in a Floating window
Launch Xposed Installer in a Floating window.
Please report any problem below. Feature requests welcome too!
Always open apps in halo except blacklisted apps
Never open apps in halo but force whitelisted apps in halo
Blacklist all apps & only allow whitelisted apps to be opened in halo
The icons originally used in XHaloFloatingWindow
Theme for those who prefer the classic icons found in a certain Operating System from a company in Redmond
Theme using Material Icons from Google, embracing Google\'s new design philosophy for a stock, fresh experience
Theme based on some leaked new Nougat navbar icons, employing bold, solid icons for a modern experience
There was an error launching the notification\nPlease report this bug:\n
Show a taskbar in the notifications shade
Turn on and off the statusbar application launcher
Shows a row of recently running apps for multi-tasking\n(Requires SystemUI restart)
Remove the notification icon\n(Requires SystemUI restart)
Choose the applications to be always shown in the statusbar taskbar
Choose the maximum applications to be show in the notification\n(Requires SystemUI restart)
